headline: PPG Industries misses estimates for fourth-quarter profit
summary: U.S. mortgage rates rose over the year, weighing on the homebuilding industry, which had previously benefited from a scarcity of pre-owned houses for sale.  Net sales in PPG's industrial coatings segment fell to $1.58 billion during the October-December quarter, compared with $1.73 billion a year earlier, hurt by a continuing trend of year-over-year declines in industrial production in the United States and Europe.  Total net sales for the company fell 5% to $3.7 billion in the fourth quarter.

Net sales in PPG's industrial coatings segment fell to $1.58 billion during the October-December quarter, compared with $1.73 billion a year earlier, hurt by a continuing trend of year-over-year declines in industrial production in the United States and Europe.  Total net sales for the company fell 5% to $3.7 billion in the fourth quarter.

headline: PPG Industries: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The Pittsburgh-based company said it had a loss of $1.20 per share. Earnings, adjusted for restructuring costs and to account for discontinued operations, came to $1.61 per share. The results did not meet Wall Street expectations.

raw.headline: PPG Industries: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: The Pittsburgh-based company said it had a loss of $1.20 per share. Earnings, adjusted for restructuring costs and to account for discontinued operations, came to $1.61 per share. The results did not meet Wall Street expectations.
